rules.name: Rule #0
rules.title: Be excellent to each other.
rules.description:
- Do not post content whose sole purpose is to cause anger or controversy
- Do not post hate speech
- Do not harass others or try to incite violence against them
- Do not discriminate based on physical characteristics (e.g. gender, race, etc) or religious beliefs
- Criticism is welcome and encouraged, but only when it's polite
- This rule applies to all content posted on site (images, comments, and everything else)
rules.example:
- Posting inflammatory comments in forums or on images
- Calling someone a slur
- Calling for violence against someone

rules.name: Rule #1
rules.title: Respect the authors of the content
rules.short_description: DNP, content theft, pay content, trace/bad edit
rules.description:
- Do not upload without permission from the author
- Do not upload private content (e.g. paid-for exclusive content) unless permitted by the author
- Do not upload copyrighted content (e.g. snippets from movies or TV shows) unless permitted by the author or applicable law
- Do not remove signatures or watermarks from images before uploading
- Respect the Do-Not-Post list
rules.example:
- Uploading private content without permission
- Uploading full movies
- Uploading AI upscaled versions of art without permission

rules.name: Rule #2
rules.title: Tag images appropriately
rules.description:
- Pick the rating tag(s) appropriately
- Try to use as many tags as you can
- Use tags appropriate to the image
rules.example:
- Tagging your upload `tagme`
- Tagging an explicit image as `safe`
- Not tagging anthro on an image containing an anthropomorphic character

rules.name: Rule #3
rules.title: Do not post content unrelated to this website's focus
rules.description:
- Do not post content unrelated to the theme of this website
- Images are not considered "related" by the presence of themed content; images must meet a threshold of artistic effort to be uploaded
rules.example:
- Posting abstract art when the site is focused on a specific fandom
- Posting photographs of real-life objects unrelated to the site's theme
- Posting unrelated memes with a small amount of themed content and no artistic effort

rules.name: Rule #4
rules.title: Use filters to hide content you don't wish to see
rules.description:
- Do not post comments expressing dislike for general themes; use filters to hide images with these themes
- If you believe something violates the site rules, report it instead of commenting about it
- Filter content which you cannot view in your current jurisdiction
rules.example:
- Commenting "I hate anthro"
- Commenting "This is disgusting" on images you could have filtered out
- Commenting about content breaking the rules instead of reporting it

rules.name: Rule #5
rules.title: Do not post content illegal in this website's jurisdiction
rules.description:
- Do not upload real-life underage pornography or art which attempts to emulate it
- Do not upload real-life bestiality or art which attempts to emulate it
- Do not upload content promoting or glorifying ideologies restricted in our jurisdiction, such as Nazism
rules.example:
- Uploading an illegal photograph
- Uploading art depicting a human-like underage character in a sexual scenario
- Uploading content promoting Nazism

rules.name: Rule #6
rules.title: Do not abuse site functionality
rules.short_description: Spam, off-topic, or general site abuse
rules.description:
- Do not use multiple accounts to evade punishments or to pretend to be two different people in the same discussion
- Do not upload spammy images, such as "reminder" style posts
- Do not create multiple comments/posts in a row
- Do not post barely-related single-word comments on images (for example, "cute" and nothing else)
- Do not post unsolicited advertisement
- Do not post off-topic comments or derail discussion
- Vote on images based on their artistic merit; do not indiscriminately vote based on a filterable characteristic of the image
- Do not impersonate staff members
rules.example:
- Using an alt account while your main account is banned
- Uploading an image just to say "Remember to stay hydrated"
- Commenting "nice" on an image without any other content
- Posting links to other websites without context or permission
- Posting a comment about politics on an image unrelated to politics

rules.name: Rule #7
rules.title: Spoiler content which cannot be filtered
rules.description:
- Respect the sexual rating of where you post; reserve NSFW posts for forum topics clearly marked as NSFW
- Use the `||spoiler syntax||` to spoiler above-rating text, which built-in site functionality cannot automatically filter
- Avatars must not contain sexual content or flickering animations which may induce seizures
rules.example:
- Posting explicit content in a general discussion topic
- Writing an above-rating description on an image without spoiler tags
- Using porn as your avatar

rules.name: Rule #8
rules.title: Respect privacy
rules.description:
- Do not reveal any personal information about artists or other users without consent
- If you are aware of an artist or a user using multiple aliases to separate their work, do not reveal this information publicly without their consent
rules.example:
- Commenting "Oh I know this artist, it's X!" on an image tagged "anonymous artist"
- Disclosing someone's real name, address, or other personal information without their consent

rules.name: Rule #9
rules.title: Advertise commissions in good faith
rules.description:
- All commissions must contain only the artwork created by the person advertising the commission
- You may not advertise a commission on behalf of another person
- Site staff are not responsible for any commission arrangements or outcomes based on commission advertisements
rules.example:
- Posing other people's art as your own in a commission advertisement
- Advertising a commission for another artist without their permission
- Misrepresenting your commission terms

rules.name: Rule #n
rules.title: Rules are not exhaustive
rules.description:
- The rules are not exhaustive; just because something is not explicitly forbidden does not mean it is allowed
- If you are unsure whether something is allowed, contact site staff for clarification
